back_text:
[skull]: -X. X is the amount of horror on you.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, take 2 horror.
[tablet]: -5. If you fail and Hastur is in play, place 1 clue on your location .
[elder_thing]: -5. If this token is revealed during an attack or evasion attempt against a Monster or Ancient One enemy, lose 1 action.
name: Dim Carcosa
text:
[skull]: -2 (-4 instead if you have no sanity remaining).
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, take 1 horror.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail and Hastur is in play, place 1 clue on your location .
[elder_thing]: -3. If this token is revealed during an attack or evasion attempt against a Monster or Ancient One enemy, lose 1 action.

back_text:
The investigators must decide (choose one):
—Any investigator tests [willpower] (4) to snap out of it. If successful, advance to agenda 2a. If failed, you must choose an option you have yet to choose.
—Any investigator tests [intellect] (4) to remember that you've done this before. If successful, advance to agenda 2a. If failed, you must choose an option you have yet to choose.
—This can't be real. This can't be real. This can't be real. Each investigator takes 2 horror. Advance to agenda 2a.
—The investigators faint and awaken some time later. Advance to agenda 2a and place 1 doom on it.
flavor: And now, far away, over leagues of tossing cloud-waves, I saw the moon dripping with spray; and beyond, the towers of Carcosa rose behind the moon.– Robert W. Chambers, “In the Court of the Dragon,” The King in Yellow
name: Madness Coils
text:
Hastur cannot be defeated.
Forced - If there is at least 3[per investigator] damage on Hastur: Advance this agenda.

back_text:
Spawn the set-aside Beast of Aldebaran enemy at the Palace of the King.
Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
flavor: I thought, too, of The King in Yellow wrapt in the fantastic colors of his tattered mantle, and that bitter cry of Cassilda, “Not upon us, oh King, not upon us!”– Robert W. Chambers, “The Mask,” The King in Yellow
name: Madness Drowns
text:
Hastur gets +1 fight and cannot be defeated.
Forced - If there is at least 5[per investigator] damage on Hastur: Advance this agenda.

back_text:
Check Campaign Log.
—If you have more (or equal) Conviction than Doubt, proceed to (→R4).
—If you have more Doubt than Conviction, proceed to (→R5).
flavor: …I cannot forget Carcosa, where black stars hang in the heavens, where the shadows of men’s thoughts lengthen in the afternoon, when the twin suns sink into the Lake of Hali, and my mind will bear forever the memory of the Pallid Mask.– Robert W. Chambers, “The Repairer of Reputations,” The King in Yellow
name: Madness Dies
text:
Hastur gets +2 fight.
Hastur cannot be defeated unless you "know the secret."

back_text: Spawn the set-aside The Man in the Pallid Mask enemy at the Palace of the King.
flavor: You have opened the path to Carcosa in order to stop those who wish to free Hastur from his prison in the stars. Only you can put an end to this madness!
name: In Lost Carcosa
text: Objective - When the investigators have collected the requisite number of clues, they must immediately spend them and advance.

back_text:
Revelation - Put The Pallid Mask into play, under the lead investigator's control. Remove The Man in the Pallid Mask from the game. Spawn the set-aside Hastur enemy at the Palace of the King.
The Pallid Mask cannot leave play.
You get -2 sanity.
flavor: It is time to finally confront the Stranger and learn the truth about his identity, once and for all.
name: Search For the Stranger (v.I)
text:
Each investigator cannot discover clues.
The Man in the Pallid Mask cannot be defeated.
Objective - While the lead investigator is at The Man in the Pallid Mask's location, he or she may spend [action] [action] [action] to advance.

back_text: Put the set-aside Hastur enemy into play next to the act deck. For the remainder of the scenario, Hastur is considered to be in play but is not at any location. Remove The Man in the Pallid Mask from the game.
flavor: It is time to finally confront the Stranger and learn the truth about his identity, once and for all.
name: Search For the Stranger (v.II)
text:
Each investigator cannot discover clues.
The Man in the Pallid Mask cannot be defeated except by his [action] ability.
Objective - When The Man in the Pallid Mask would be defeated by his [action] ability, advance.

back_text: Spawn the set-aside Hastur enemy at The Man in the Pallid Mask's location. Remove The Man in the Pallid Mask from the game.
flavor: It is time to finally confront the Stranger and learn the truth about his identity, once and for all.
name: Search For the Stranger (v.III)
text:
Each investigator cannot discover clues.
The Man in the Pallid Mask cannot be defeated except by damage.
Objective - When The Man in the Pallid Mask would be defeated by damage, advance.

back_text:
—If Hastur was the version of Hastur that was defeated, proceed to (→R1).
—If Hastur was the version of Hastur that was defeated, proceed to (→R2).
—If Hastur was the version of Hastur that was defeated, proceed to (→R3).
flavor: …I heard the King in Yellow whispering to my soul: “It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God!”– Robert W. Chambers, “In the Court of the Dragon,” The King in Yellow
name: The King in Tatters
text:
[free] If there are no clues on your location: Remove each investigator's clues from the game. Flip your location over and resolve the text on the other side.
Objective - If Hastur is defeated, advance.

flavor: Along the shore the cloud waves break,The twin suns sink behind the lake,The shadows lengthenIn Carcosa– Robert W. Chambers, The King in Yellow
name: Shores of Hali
text:
Deal 1[per investigator] damage to Hastur, exhaust him, and disengage him from all investigators.
Flip this card back over. For the remainder of the game, it cannot be flipped over again.

back_text: While you are at Bleak Plains, you cannot play Ally assets.
flavor: On every side of me stretched a bleak and desolate expanse of plain, covered with a tall overgrowth of sere grass, which rustled and whistled in the autumn wind…– Ambrose Bierce, “An Inhabitant of Carcosa”
name: Bleak Plains
text:
Each investigator heals 3 horror.
Deal 4 damage to an enemy in play other than Hastur.
Remove this card from the game, and replace it with another set-aside copy of Bleak Plains (move all investigators, enemies, and attachments from this location to the new copy of Bleak Plains). Add clues to that copy of Bleak Plains until it has clues on it equal to its clue value.

back_text: While you are at Bleak Plains, you cannot play Ally assets.
flavor: On every side of me stretched a bleak and desolate expanse of plain, covered with a tall overgrowth of sere grass, which rustled and whistled in the autumn wind…– Ambrose Bierce, “An Inhabitant of Carcosa”
name: Bleak Plains
text:
Deal 2[per investigator]  damage to Hastur.
Flip this card back over. For the remainder of the game, it cannot be flipped over again.

back_text: Forced - After you discover the last remaining clue on Ruins of Carcosa: Take 1 damage.
flavor: So old seemed these relics, these vestiges of vanity and memorials of affection and piety, so battered and worn and stained…– Ambrose Bierce, “An Inhabitant of Carcosa”
name: Ruins of Carcosa
text:
Each investigator heals 3 horror.
Remove this card from the game, and replace it with another set-aside copy of Ruins of Carcosa (move all investigators, enemies, and attachments from this location to the new copy of Ruins of Carcosa). Add clues to that copy of Ruins of Carcosa until it has clues on it equal to its clue value.

back_text: Forced - After you discover the last remaining clue on Ruins of Carcosa: Take 1 damage.
flavor: So old seemed these relics, these vestiges of vanity and memorials of affection and piety, so battered and worn and stained…– Ambrose Bierce, “An Inhabitant of Carcosa”
name: Ruins of Carcosa
text:
You must decide (choose one):
-Choose an enemy in play. Exhaust that enemy and disengage it from all investigators.
-You heal 5 horror.
Remove this card from the game, and replace it with another set-aside copy of Ruins of Carcosa (move all investigators, enemies, and attachments from this location to the new copy of Ruins of Carcosa). Add clues to that copy of Ruins of Carcosa until it has clues on it equal to its clue value.

back_text: Forced - After you discover the last remaining clue on Ruins of Carcosa: Take 1 damage.
flavor: So old seemed these relics, these vestiges of vanity and memorials of affection and piety, so battered and worn and stained…– Ambrose Bierce, “An Inhabitant of Carcosa”
name: Ruins of Carcosa
text:
Deal 1[per investigator]  damage to Hastur.
Flip this card back over. For the remainder of the game, it cannot be flipped over again.

back_text: Forced - After you discover the last remaining clue on Dim Streets: Lose 1 action.
flavor: The streets twist and churn without any semblance of logic or reason.
name: Dim Streets
text:
Test [intellect] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 horror. Deal 1[per investigator] damage to Hastur regardless of whether you succeed or fail.
After this test ends, flip this card back over. For the remainder of the game, it cannot be flipped over again.

back_text: Forced - After you discover the last remaining clue on Dim Streets: Lose 1 action.
flavor: The streets twist and churn without any semblance of logic or reason.
name: Dim Streets
text:
Test [combat] (2). If you succeed, exhaust Hastur and disengage him from all investigators.
Remove this card from the game, and replace it with another set-aside copy of Dim Streets (move all investigators, enemies, and attachments from this location to the new copy of Dim Streets). Add clues to that copy of Dim Streets until it has clues on it equal to its clue value.

back_text: Forced - After you discover the last remaining clue on Dim Streets: Lose 1 action.
flavor: The streets twist and churn without any semblance of logic or reason.
name: Dim Streets
text:
Test [willpower] (1). For each point you succeed by, heal 1 horror.
Remove this card from the game, and replace it with another set-aside copy of Dim Streets (move all investigators, enemies, and attachments from this location to the new copy of Dim Streets). Add clues to that copy of Dim Streets until it has clues on it equal to its clue value.

back_text: While you are at Depths of Demhe, you cannot play fast cards.
flavor: Don’t look up.
name: Depths of Demhe
text:
Each investigator heals 5 horror.
Remove this card from the game, and replace it with another set-aside copy of Depths of Demhe (move all investigators, enemies, and attachments from this location to the new copy of Depths of Demhe). Add clues to that copy of Depths of Demhe until it has clues on it equal to its clue value.

back_text: While you are at Depths of Demhe, you cannot play fast cards.
flavor: Don’t look up.
name: Depths of Demhe
text:
Deal 1[per investigator] damage to Hastur, exhaust him, and disengage him from all investigators.
Flip this card back over. For the remainder of the game, it cannot be flipped over again.

flavor: Night fell and the hours dragged on, but still we murmured to each other of the King and the Pallid Mask, and midnight sounded from the misty spires in the fog-wrapped city.– Robert W. Chambers, “The Yellow Sign,” The King in Yellow
name: Dark Spires
text:
You must decide (choose one):
- Flip this card back over.
- Take 2 horror and deal 2[per investigator] damage to Hastur. Flip this card back over. For the remainder of the game, it cannot be flipped over again.

back_text: Palace of the King cannot be flipped over unless Hastur has at least 5[per investigator] damage on him.
flavor: I pray God will curse the writer, as the writer has cursed the world with this beautiful, stupendous creation, terrible in its simplicity, irresistible in its truth…– Robert W. Chambers, “The Repairer of Reputations,” The King in Yellow
name: Palace of the King
text:
Remember that you "know the secret."
Flip this card back over. For the remainder of the game, it cannot be flipped over again.

name: Hastur
text:
Cannot be damaged except by story card effects.
Forced - At the beginning of the enemy phase, if Hastur is ready: Hastur attacks each investigator, in player order . If Hastur's attack deals you horror in excess of your sanity, you take 1 damage, as well.
[action]: Test [willpower] (X), where X is Hastur's fight value. If you succeed, exhaust Hastur. Any investigator may trigger this action.

name: Hastur
text:
Prey - Most remaining sanity.
Hunter. Massive.
If Hastur's attack deals you horror in excess of your sanity, you take 1 damage, as well.
While Hastur is being attacked or evaded by an investigator with no remaining sanity, treat each [elder_sign], "+1," "0," or "-1" token that investigator reveals as a [auto-fail] token.

name: Hastur
text:
Prey - Most remaining sanity.
Hunter.
If Hastur's attack deals you horror in excess of your sanity, you take 1 damage, as well.
While Hastur is being attacked or evaded by an investigator with no remaining sanity, treat each [elder_sign], "+1," "0," or "-1" token that investigator reveals as a [auto-fail] token.

name: Creature Out of Demhe
text:
Spawn - Depths of Demhe.
Massive.
Forced - When Creature out of Demhe's location or a connecting location is flipped over, if Creature out of Demhe is ready: It attacks each investigator at that location.

name: Winged One
text:
Spawn - Bleak Plains.
Retaliate.
Forced - After a location is flipped over, if Winged One is ready and unengaged: Move it once toward that location.

name: Dismal Curse
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you have no remaining sanity, this test gets +2 difficulty. If you fail, take 2 damage (4 damage instead if you have horror on you greater than twice your sanity).

flavor: …But stranger still is Lost Carcosa.
name: Realm of Madness
text: Revelation - Discard cards from play and/or from your hand with a total printed resource cost of at least X, where X is the amount of horror on your investigator. If no cards are discarded by this effect, take 2 horror.

name: The Final Act
text:
Surge.
Revelation - If you have no remaining sanity, place 2 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance.

name: Possession (Traitorous)
text:
Peril. Hidden.
Revelation - Secretly add Possession (Traitorous) to your hand.
If you have horror on you greater than twice your sanity, you are immediately eliminated and killed.
You may commit this card to a skill test at your location. That test automatically fails.

name: Possession (Torturous)
text:
Peril. Hidden.
Revelation - Secretly add Possession (Torturous) to your hand.
If you have horror on you greater than twice your sanity, you are immediately eliminated and killed.
[action] Spend 5 resources: Discard Possession (Torturous) from your hand.

name: Possession (Murderous)
text:
Peril. Hidden.
Revelation - Secretly add Possession (Murderous) to your hand.
If you have horror on you greater than twice your sanity, you are immediately eliminated and killed.
[action] Deal 2 damage to an investigator at your location: Discard Possession (Murderous) from your hand.
